sen.j: 橘大郎女（たちばな の おおいらつめ、生没年不詳）は、聖徳太子の妃。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume (date of birth and death unknown) was a wife of Prince Shotoku.
TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a wife of the Prince Shotoku.
sen.cmt: date→year,スペースを修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a wife of the Prince Shotoku.

sen.j: 父は敏達天皇の皇子・尾張皇子で、推古天皇の孫に当たる。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Owari no Oji, a son of Emperor Bidatsu and her grandmother was Empress Suiko.
She was a daughter of Owari no Oji, a son of the Emperor Bidatsu and her grandmother was the Empress Suiko.
She was a daughter of Owari no Oji, a son of the Emperor Bidatsu and her grandmother was the Empress Suiko.

sen.j: 聖徳太子との子に白髪部王、手嶋女王の二人。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume and Prince Shotoku had two children, Shirakabe no Miko (Prince Shirakabe) and Teshima no Himemiko (Princess Teshima).
TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume and the Prince Shotoku had two children, Shirakabe no Miko (the Prince Shirakabe) and Teshima no Himemiko (the Princess Teshima).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume and the Prince Shotoku had two children, Shirakabe no Miko (the Prince Shirakabe) and Teshima no Himemiko (the Princess Teshima).

sen.j: 622年に聖徳太子が死ぬと、橘大郎女は推古天皇に願い出て、釆女に天寿国曼荼羅繍帳（てんじゅこくまんだらしゅうちょう、天寿国繍帳とも言う）を作らせた。
sen.e: When Prince Shotoku died in 622, with the permission of Empress Suiko, TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume commissioned the Tenjukoku Mandara Shucho (tapestries with embroideries representing Tenjuku paradise, also called Tenjukoku Shucho).

When the Prince Shotoku died in 622, with the permission of the Empress Suiko, TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume ordered Uneme (the ancient court hostess) to make the Tenjukoku Mandara Shucho (tapestries with embroideries representing Tenjuku paradise, also called Tenjukoku Shucho).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。スペースを修正しました。「釆女」を補い、commissioned→ordered to make と修正しました。
sen.e: When the Prince Shotoku died in 622, with the permission of the Empress Suiko, TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume ordered Uneme (the ancient court hostess) to make the Tenjukoku Mandara Shucho (tapestries with embroideries representing Tenjuku paradise, also called Tenjukoku Shucho).

sen.j: これは、聖徳太子の死を悼んで、死後に行ったとされる天寿国の様子を描かせたものと言われる。
sen.e: It is believed that mourning his death, TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume wished to picture the Tenjuku paradise where Prince Shotoku was believed to have been after his death on these tapestries.
It is believed that mourning his death, TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume wished to picture the Tenjukoku paradise where the Prince Shotoku was believed to have been after his death.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Tenjuku→Tenjukoku と修正しました。on these tapestries を削除しました。
sen.e: It is believed that mourning his death, TACHIBANA no Ooiratsume wished to picture the Tenjukoku paradise where the Prince Shotoku was believed to have been after his death.

sen.j: 現存する日本最古の刺繍で、国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: They are believed to be the oldest existing embroideries and designated as a National Treasure.
It is the oldest existing embroidery and designated as a National Treasure.
sen.cmt: They are believed to be→It is,embroideries→embroidery と修正しました。
sen.e: It is the oldest existing embroidery and designated as a National Treasure.

sen.j: 中宮寺に伝わっていたが、大部分が失われ、現在では残片が残るのみである。
sen.e: Tenjukoku Mandara Shucho had been preserved in the Chuguji Temple, but there are only fragments of the embroideries remaining today, with most of them being lost.
The Tenjukoku Mandara Shucho had been preserved in Chugu-ji Temple, but there are only fragments of the embroidery remaining today, with most of them being lost.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。in the Chuguji→in Chugu-ji,embroideries→embroidery と修正しました。
sen.e: The Tenjukoku Mandara Shucho had been preserved in Chugu-ji Temple, but there are only fragments of the embroidery remaining today, with most of them being lost.
